New Records: LeBron James extended his streak of 1,226 games with at least 10 points.
Anthony Davis tied Lakers legends Jerry West and Elgin Baylor by scoring 35+ points in two consecutive games.
Key Match Events: A critical moment came when LeBron James, with the Lakers trailing by three, intentionally missed a free throw but failed to secure the rebound, allowing the Suns to seal the win with free throws from Bradley Beal.
Kevin Durant's late-game strategy of 'hunting' smaller defenders was pivotal to the Suns' comeback.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers' head coach JJ Redick took responsibility for not adjusting the defense earlier in the fourth quarter to counter Durant's strategy.
The Lakers' strong start to the season (3-1) ties for their best in the LeBron James era, reminiscent of their championship-winning season in 2019-20.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns' adjustments in the fourth quarter were crucial to their comeback.
The Lakers' performance tied their best start in the LeBron James era, highlighting their historical dominance.
